displaytitle: Plan and elevation of St. Michael's Church, Oxford: background study for The Martyrdom of Ridley and Latimer
creditline: Gift of George L. Small, Class of 1943
inscribed:
in black ink: Tower | A. This is now a square belfry | window - was originally - in all | probability like the others. | North | South | East | D. This is a low [underlined] vestry | (original) but | not visible | over the | city wall | -This is a little decorated | window (C) | above the roof of the vestry | rises a perpendicular | window. - | This Window is | also a perpendicular window | like D. | These are two Perpendicular | Windows also the same as D. | The Aisle has a lean-to roof | of about this angle - Not so acute | as the nave roof. Also allow | a break - of a couple of feet | this | nave | aisle | Bocardo was here - abouts | 19 1/2 or 30 feet
Printed plan title: Plan of St. Michael's Church, printed by P.H. De la Motte, Oxford

titles.title: Plan of St. Michael's Church, Oxford

Album containing 99 original drawings and 87 architecture, portrait, and costume studies of a documentary nature for the paintings Latimer Preaching at Paul's Cross and The Martyrdom of Ridley and Latimer.

makers.displaymaker: Sir George Hayter, 1792–1871; born and died London, England
